channel.title: Embeding html in html..?
channel.description:
Ok so im making a website, and i have like 120 pages i made for the website all in html. All 120 of them have the same sidebar.
So every time I edit 1 of the sidebars, i have to go to the other 119 pages and edit the sidebar on them to match the 1 I edited.
So I was wondering if i could somehow just make a html page with just the sidebar (sidebar.html). Then in the 120 pages i could somehow just embed sidebar.html in them.
So if I could do this, then I would only have to edit the sidebar.html and all of the sidebars on every page is already done.
Is this possible?

item.title: Embeding html in html..?
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Heh, I knew I’d give a bad description. Perhaps my idea is bad.

Anyways, with my idea, if you were to implement it would be to

  • Make a template page that is like all of your others, includes the sidebar and everything you want but none of its own content
  • This template page would have the PHP inside of the tags, or wherever your content changes between pages.
  • The PHP grabs a HTML file you point it to, which should only have the body text that you want to include and nothing else, using the keywords in the array.

Can any one else explain it better?

To paraphrase, the PHP would go on one page and one page only. The pages are switched by changing the keyword. If “anime” was a keyword to your page of, um, anime, you’d have it like ‘filename.php?id=anime’. You’re loading up the same page each time, the change in keyword grabs a new file.

Read full topic

item.title: Embeding html in html..?
item.dc:creator: @Gtech_Warriors Gtech Warriors
item.description:
@Gtech_Warriors wrote:

i tried aligning it but couldnt figure out how to… and even if i did, i wouldnt want that white frame around it…

and testdummy… im kinda confused on what u said…

So im supposed to put

[code]<?php
$id = strtolower($_GET[‘id’]);

$page = array(
“keyword_1” => “filename”
“keyword_2” => “filename”
// etc…
);

if (array_key_exists($id, $page)) {
print file_get_contents($page[$id]);
}
else {
print file_get_contents(“error.html”);
}
?>[/code]

on all my 120 pages… then what?

Read full topic

item.title: Embeding html in html..?
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Hm, I did something like this a few days ago, but I didn’t use frames.
I made a template HTML page (with some PHP tossed in) that had everything that repeated on the older pages (navigation, copyrights, etc.)
and made it so the content of every other page was included into the template page.

I put this in the body of my template page.

[code=php]<?php
$id = strtolower($_GET[‘id’]);

$page = array(
“keyword_1” => “filename”
“keyword_2” => “filename”
// etc…
);

if (array_key_exists($id, $page)) {
print file_get_contents($page[$id]);
}
else {
print file_get_contents(“error.html”);
}
?>[/code]

All the other pages that this called on only consisted of the body content that actually changed. Everything else was stripped away.

This thread isn’t the most appropriate place to ask, but is there anything inherently wrong with my design? I mean, it works when implemented, but I mean from a security standpoint.

Edit: You’d have to edit all 120 pages to make this work right initially, but afterwards, you wouldn’t need to worry about sidebar changes.

Read full topic

item.title: Embeding html in html..?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

If it’s a sidebar, you wouldn’t use an IFrame, you’d use a frame.

Except frames are evil, and it would be better to use something serverside, like php.
If that’s not available, use a frame.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Gtech_Warriors wrote:

ya… that aint exactly working… (oh and by the way my background is made with css if u need to know that)

So here is the sidebar normally (usually has a lot more links, like 50) - http://img443.imageshack.us/img443/1134/untitledyd8.png

Then I make the sidebar.html by cutting the html code for the sidebar (in index.html) and putting it in the sidebar.html . Then where the sidebar used to be in index.html, I put you iframe code.

Then this is how it came out - http://img265.imageshack.us/img265/2941/untitledal4.png …

so is there another solution for this?
